metadata.jobTitle: Director of Engineering, Security Risk Management

aiResponses.unnamed_7:
I am a results-driven engineering leader and hands-on software engineer with six years of experience building secure, scalable platforms. In my current role as Senior Software Engineer at TechCorp (2020–Present), I led initiatives to harden our CI/CD pipelines and container deployments, introducing automated dependency scanning, image vulnerability checks, and runtime monitoring across our AWS-hosted services. These efforts reduced the number of production security incidents by measurable margins and accelerated our mean-time-to-detect while preserving developer velocity.

Prior to TechCorp, at StartupXYZ (2018–2020) I built and shipped backend services using Node.js and Python, architected authentication and authorization flows, and implemented logging and observability that supported rapid incident investigation. I routinely worked with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and Git-driven CI/CD; my practical experience, combined with certifications like AWS Certified Solutions Architect and Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), gives me the technical depth to partner effectively with security, infra, and product teams.

I am excited by the Director of Engineering, Security Risk Management role because it aligns with my experience improving platform security at scale and mentoring engineers to build secure systems by default. I bring a pragmatic balance of strategic vision and hands-on execution: designing risk-reduction programs, deploying automation to embed security in the SDLC, and coaching teams to adopt best practices. I’m enthusiastic about GitLab’s DevSecOps mission and AI-first productivity approach, and I’m eager to help scale security programs that enable engineering teams to move quickly and safely.
aiResponses.question_33402666002:
I do not require any interview adjustments at this time. I appreciate inclusive interview practices and am happy to request accommodations if needed for a particular interview stage.

If an accommodation is helpful, I may request things like captioning for recorded interviews, a shared agenda in advance, or a short break during longer interview sessions. I am flexible and will communicate promptly if any adjustments are needed.
